questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Become faster at writing functions and learn some shortcuts for my scripts

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I am planning to learn and apply R for my research which I never had to do it before.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I want to further develop my skills in R and get a better understanding of version control and how to better process my data. Afterwards I want to feel more comfortable working in R.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I want to learn to be more reproducible, store the data in a core folder and then use R to manipulate and arrange it further. I do a lot of data wrangling in my day to day and I'd like to be more efficient and faster.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I will like to improve my performence when coding in R, be agile and understand better what I code.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: I would like to be more efficient in storing (e.g., save an environment to GitHub) and writing my data analysis (e.g., use of functions)

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Improve my data science and analysis skills, and learn to do it in a reproducible way.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Learn how to produce more reproducible code, learn how to make my own functions, learn more about the purrr package, useful tools for tidying up datasets

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Workflow management and data manipulation in R. Presently, I do most of my data analysis in Python, and then do plotting in R. I would like to minimize the amount of back-and-forth, and do more of my work in R.

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: Workflow strategies for data analysis

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: better, more structured ways of working, I would like to be able to have a more reproducible way of coding in general

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: make reproducible code

questions: What do you expect to learn from this course and what would you like to be able to do afterward with what you've learned?
responses: tidier, more reproducible, and more efficient data management and processing with R

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: I had some problems, still have on this r3::install_packages_intermediate()

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: When installing R packages, the pak::pak("rostools/r3") command gave me an error, but running remotes::install_github("rostools/r3") instead helped.

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: i got an error message when i tried to install pak::pak("rostools/r3"), but it doesnt work because i havent generated personal account token in Github before that. after i generated the personal token, link it with my GIt (googled a bit how to do it because i dont remember), restarted the R, then did it again, it worked. perhaps these steps can be made clearer in the pre-course task.
